poem:
Title: Legionaries Lament

Steel echoes resound in hallowed halls, a
lexicon of past conflict whispers stories.
Roman might, pressed into clay and stone,
Yet in the quiet hum of museum night,
Truth bares cold teeth in shadowed corners.
What of life in the relentless march,
Of homes left, hearts bled?
Art immortalises, yet omits, the weight of a 
Legionary's shield, borne long after battle.
